intro: Uragoga hyptoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hyptoid, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It often grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds.
